segment.tokens: The Felis Leopardus the Felis Pardus of authors represent the Leopard Panther
it has been to establish any characters
any characters mark the difference between them
Size colour form position of spots have been resorted to
age locality have set all rules aside
therefore treating of them I shall use the term indiscriminately
Their extreme beauty their greater docility make them more interesting than the tiger
nevertheless they like others of the feline tribe should not be treated too unreservedly
Their internal anatomy dentition agree with those of the tiger they slighter particularly abundant in most parts of Africa
they are of slighter particularly abundant in most parts of Africa
make
are of the East
They are exceedingly graceful
swim climb trees
slide along the ground like a snake
are very to spring upon their victims from the branches of trees
Their coat is of that beautiful shade of tawny , which forms so good a contrast with their black rosettes , or spots
that beautiful shade of tawny forms so good a contrast with their black rosettes , or spots
My first personal acquaintance with leopards and panthers was made on the leeward coast of Africa
brought by Mr. Bowdich myself in a living state to this country at first
one of the latter brought by Mr. Bowdich and myself in a living state to this country , at first delighted the men of science
because in his remarkably beautiful coat they hoped to find characters
characters would mark the difference between these two animals
as we produced skin after skin
they began again to doubt
the problem still remains unsolved
My history of the Ashanti panther has been so often repeated in various works
that I should hesitate to introduce it here in a form which did not originate with myself
had it not more than once been presented to the public
a form did not originate with myself
The only other account from my own pen was supplied to Mr. Loudon for his Magazine of Natural History , to which I now make a few additions
for his Magazine of Natural History , to which I now make a few additions
The panther I allude
The panther was of two cubs , found in one of the forests of the kingdom of Ashanti
found in one of the forests of the kingdom of Ashanti
They were both taken to the king
( the resident left in Kumasi by Mr. Bowdich )
when Mr. Hutchison came to head-quarters
his Majesty desired this one to be presented to the Governor
He had suffocated his brother in a fit of romping he good-tempered
he was extremely good-tempered
and was led a chain only
being
let
loose when eating was going forward
which occasions he received his share
he helped himself to a fowl once twice
as he always gave it up to his master
he was occasionally employed to secure provisions
when the natives surlily refused a supply
He was one with his chin on the latter 's shoulder
sitting behind Mr. Hutchison
when this gentleman refreshed himself pouring some lavender water on his handkerchief
In an instant this panther tore it of his hand in a state of ecstasy
this panther ceased to roll over it
till the cambric was in fragments
The day after his arrival at Cape Coast he was led into the hall where we were all dining
where we were all dining
he received our salutations with apparent pleasure
On one occasion he stood on his hind legs
he put his fore paws on the shoulders of an officer , who hastily retreated
an officer hastily retreated
it was to see the unconquerable dread of him
the unconquerable dread of him assailed men
men were undaunted
where men only were concerned
We named the panther " Saï " after the king
he was kept in a small court
his claws teeth were filed
no live food was given to him
A boy was appointed to watch him
He was perfectly
he evinced
the only violence was
when a servant pulled his food from him
he then tore a piece out of the man 's leg
Once he escaped
he dashed on to the ramparts , where he caused a scene of confusion which was quite laughable
where he caused a scene of confusion which was quite laughable
confusion was quite
the sentinels fled
the officers closed their doors
the castle gates were shut
when he was of his scamper
the playful beast quietly laid himself down under a gun carriage
the playful beast suffered his attendant to lead him away
At last he was allowed to roam at large
orders being given to prevent his going beyond the gates
the boy was desired not to leave him
He however often fell asleep
which occasions Saï would come stealthily behind him
as he sat upright
occasions Saï knock him over with a blow from his paw
when he wagged his tail with delight
His principal amusement was to stand on his hind legs
his fore paws resting on the sill of one of the windows , his chin between them
there contemplate all
all was going on in the town below
this was also a favourite with my uncle 's children so without
there was not always room for all
they often pulled him down by the tail without exciting his anger
they took his place
His attachment to my uncle was very
he chiefly lived in his room
He missed him one day
when he was holding a great palaver in the hall
he wandered about in search of him
The multitude prevented the panther seeing his friend
he wandered to other parts of the castle among others to my room , where he laid himself down with a disconsolate look
where he laid himself down with a disconsolate look
The palaver over the Governor returned to his room to write
he heard Saï coming slowly up the stairs
The panther started
when he saw the object of his search
as he made one
bound across the room
my uncle gave himself up
lost
the affectionate creature nestled his head into his master 's shoulder
the affectionate creature rubbed his cheek against him
the affectionate creature only tried by caresses to evince his happiness
He was very hiding himself under one of the sofas in the hall , where a rustling noise , a protruding paw , or an occasional peep from behind the cover , alone betrayed his presence
where a rustling noise a protruding paw an occasional peep from behind the cover alone betrayed his presence
The Governor was once some officers from Elmina
when in the midst of an animated discussion they both turned pale
The Governor stopped
speaking
Their host looked up " "
I beg your pardon "
" said one of them
but are you
what animal is now lying under that sofa
" said my uncle
" Saï " come "
Saï speak to these gentlemen
The panther walked up to them
both darted behind the Governor
did they feel comfortable
when Saï was ordered back to his hiding-place
I bantered one of them about his fears when I met him at dinner
his fears when I met him dinner
he confessed
that he had never been more
attending Saï presence at the castle
occurred to a woman who swept the floor of the great hall every day before dinner was laid with a little hand-broom
a woman swept the floor of the great hall every day
before dinner was laid
One of the drollest circumstances attending Saï 's presence at the castle called a prah-prah
She was engaged in her usual occupation knowing
that Saï was
Saï stooping almost on all fours
when with a sudden impulse of fun the panther jumped upon her back
the panther stood there
the panther wagging his tail
Naturally supposing
she was going to be devoured
the poor prah-prah woman screamed so
whereupon
they being of the same opinion as herself
they thinking
their turn might come next
violently as to bring the other servants ran away
to bring the other servants was
she released
hearing the noise
till the governor came to her assistance
